body: Actually, I'd like to close this because after speaking with mirrorbox in the irc channel, it seems that this is no longer a problem with the latest version 0.4.x of libcloud, as it no longer uses zope.
plus 1. I needed this feature for deploy_node and can confirm it works.

Hi Andrew,

Thanks for the contribution; it has been committed in r1054021.

Based on convention, I namespaced the new classes so they are now RackspaceSharedIpGroup and RackspaceNodeIpAddresses.

Cheers,
Jerry

Sure thing.

Well, drat, github does not support attachments to issues? Here is the code inline, then:

```
Index: libcloud/drivers/ec2.py
===================================================================
--- libcloud/drivers/ec2.py (revision 1072049)
+++ libcloud/drivers/ec2.py (working copy)
@@ -636,6 +636,48 @@
             tags[key] = value
         return tags

+    def ex_create_tags(self, node, tags):
+        """
+        Create tags for an instance.
+
+        @type node: C{Node}
+        @param node: Node instance
+        @param tags: A dictionary or other mapping of strings to strings,
+                     associating tag names with tag values.
+        """
+        if not tags:
+            return
+
+        params = { 'Action': 'CreateTags',
+                   'ResourceId.0': node.id }
+        for i, key in enumerate(tags):
+            params['Tag.%d.Key' % i] = key
+            params['Tag.%d.Value' % i] = tags[key]
+
+        self.connection.request(self.path,
+                                params=params.copy()).object
+
+    def ex_delete_tags(self, node, tags):
+        """
+        Delete tags from an instance.
+
+        @type node: C{Node}
+        @param node: Node instance
+        @param tags: A dictionary or other mapping of strings to strings,
+                     specifying the tag names and tag values to be deleted.
+        """
+        if not tags:
+            return
+
+        params = { 'Action': 'DeleteTags',
+                   'ResourceId.0': node.id }
+        for i, key in enumerate(tags):
+            params['Tag.%d.Key' % i] = key
+            params['Tag.%d.Value' % i] = tags[key]
+
+        self.connection.request(self.path,
+                                params=params.copy()).object
+
     def ex_describe_addresses(self, nodes):
         """
         Return Elastic IP addresses for all the nodes in the provided list.
```
Thanks for your contribution. This has been submitted in r1072101.

And here are some tests!

         self.assertTrue('owner' in tags)
         self.assertTrue('stack' in tags)

+    def test_ex_create_tags(self):
+        node = Node('i-4382922a', None, None, None, None, self.driver)
+        self.driver.ex_create_tags(node, {'sample': 'tag'})
+
+    def test_ex_delete_tags(self):
+        node = Node('i-4382922a', None, None, None, None, self.driver)
+        self.driver.ex_delete_tags(node, {'sample': 'tag'})

         node1 = Node('i-4382922a', None, None, None, None, self.driver)
         ip_addresses1 = self.driver.ex_describe_addresses_for_node(node1)
@@ -233,6 +241,14 @@
         body = self.fixtures.load('describe_tags.xml')
         return (httplib.OK, body, {}, httplib.responses[httplib.OK])

+    def _CreateTags(self, method, url, body, headers):
+        body = self.fixtures.load('create_tags.xml')
+        return (httplib.OK, body, {}, httplib.responses[httplib.OK])
+
+    def _DeleteTags(self, method, url, body, headers):
+        body = self.fixtures.load('delete_tags.xml')
+        return (httplib.OK, body, {}, httplib.responses[httplib.OK])
+
     def _DescribeAddresses(self, method, url, body, headers):
         body = self.fixtures.load('describe_addresses_multi.xml')
         return (httplib.OK, body, {}, httplib.responses[httplib.OK])

I think this pull request can be closed.

It's been almost 10 months since the last commit in this pull request. How about closing this pull request and encouraging the participants to submit smaller pull request(s) that are based on the current code base?
Sadly we (libcloud developers) don't have admin access to the Github repository and can't manage the pull requests which means it can only be closed by the author.
This patch has been merged. Can the author please close the pull request?
Closed.

Committed into trunk. Thanks.

Next time please also open a ticket on our bug tracker (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LIBCLOUD).

The problem is that we don't have admin access to the Github repo and we also don't get notified when a new pull request is opened.

I'd say it's beyond obvious that this repository is not working within the standard Github workflow, and is really meant just as a mirror of the official repository. I am not currently using libcloud for anything, and don't care to maintain the fork or update the patch to work with the current code base.
This was accepted and merged into libcloud svn trunk. See upstream JIRA issue.

Can you please also add some tests?

cloud.com not provide DNS host for api (or I'm bad see)

libcloud is not a collection of dependencies on other python code.  it is a library interacting with rest APIs.

this has been a core part of its design from the very beginning.

-1 to merging.
Can you please also add tests for all the newly added functionally?

It looks like a lot of functionality between 1.0 and 1.1 could be re-used.

I would vote for creating a base `OpenStackNodeDriver` class where we would put common functionality. Then both 1.0 and 1.1 class drivers should inherit from it and implement just the differences.
Kami: what you suggest about having an `OpenStackNodeDriver` is exactly what I did in my [previous pull-request](https://github.com/apache/libcloud/pull/26); but that was rejected.

https://github.com/apache/libcloud/pull/25#issuecomment-2296043

Hm, I noticed another thing. How do you currently instantiate 1.1 driver via `get_provider`? Looks like we only have a provider constant for version 1.0.

I like the idea me and @Manganeez originally talked about. Each provider driver which has support for multiple API versions should only have a single provider constant and a base class which constructor takes `version` argument.

Based on this version argument, base class would then instantiate a correct version-specific class - constructor method would basically be a factory method. As far as I know @Manganeez has already implemented something like this in his original pull request.

I have merged your patch (with some changes) into trunk in [1187584](http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1187584&view=rev).

Next time please make sure `pep8` tool returns no warnings for modified files.

Also, can you please close this pull request now (we can't do it)?

Pull request merged as single blob: https://github.com/apache/libcloud/commit/211a6b5219a94f0d11e42e5198f7729cc361cb2f

Suvish V.T.

Thanks for this patch and a bug report!

While reviewing and testing your patch I also found some bugs myself and I have merged your bug fixes and mine into trunk today - https://github.com/apache/libcloud/commits/trunk.

I also wanted to include this fixes in the next release so I have canceled a vote for Libcloud 0.6.0 and started a new one for Libcloud 0.6.1 which includes those bug fixes.

For now I have also only merged essential bug-fixes, because I didn't want to introduce any new possible bugs which could creep in through the new features.

I will merge new features into trunk as soon as you add tests for them. 

If you need help with writing the tests, let us know ([Writing tests and using the fixture framework](http://libcloud.apache.org/docs/writing-tests-and-using-the-fixture-framework.html) page should also help you).

Ok, I'm write tests.
Thank You for fast reaction
Hi, will the patches be accepted for the next release?
I will take a look at the updated patch later on today.

I hope I have written the tests appropriately now. I ran the tests, and they work. I have also added some more functionality to the driver (elastic address association, describe all the addresses, list only specific nodes).

I have merged your changes without the `ex_list_nodes` for now (r120273 - http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1202734).

Currently `ex_list_nodes` contains too much copy and pasted code from `list_nodes` and I'm not even sure if this is the best approach. For this function it might even make more sense to take a list of node ids as an argument instead of a list of Node objects.

Some thing to keep in mind for future contributions:
- work on your changes in a separate branch
- always make sure your branch with changes is synced with the latest trunk
- don't include trailing whitespace
- run pep8 on the changed file (line-length, line breaks)

Thanks.

Thanks a lot, Tomaz. I'll definitely take note of your suggestions.

 Regarding the `ex_list_nodes`, I had previously added a list of node_ids as the parameter, but reverted to using a list of nodes as I saw that was the pattern used elsewhere in the code. How about adding a parameter of `node_ids=None` to the `list_nodes` method itself?

Yeah, I would be ok with adding `ex_node_ids` argument to the `list_nodes` method.

It also needs to be clearly documented what it does.

Added in r1205005 - http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1205005.

Hey, @tildedave actually had a good suggestion on the IRC.

It would be better for `NodeBase` to be a mixin instead of a base class. Here is an example of a Mixin class we use in tests - https://github.com/apache/libcloud/blob/trunk/test/compute/__init__.py#L20. Also, better name for this class would be `UuidMixin`.

Edit: Basically, I would do the following:
1. Name the base class `UuidMixin`
2. Remove `__init__` and `__repr__` method and just keep `get_uuid` method
3. Update affected code
